intro: Roldana cordovensis, commonly known as the Cordova's roldana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, rocky habitats at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
